title: Bug 49299: Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrect custom cookie name behavior
description: Bug 49299: The documentation in Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 states that a custom cookie name affects URL rewriting, but the actual behavior does not match the documentation.
OB: When a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the custom name is not used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL, although URL rewriting has been enabled. Instead, the page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE'. The URL generated by the 'Reload' link on the page uses the default 'jsessionid' parameter.
EB: The documentation should be updated to reflect the actual behavior. When a web application configures a custom cookie name for session tracking, the custom name should be used as the name of the URI parameter in the URL when the session ID is encoded in the URL.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Configure a custom cookie name for session tracking in a web application. 2. Enable URL rewriting. 3. Access a page in the web application. 4. Check the name of the cookie sent by the page. 5. Click on the 'Reload' link on the page and observe the URL generated, checking if the custom cookie name is used as the name of the URI parameter.
